summary.title: IoT  Security Threat Model
summary.description: Threat model for Python-based IoT Honeypot simulating vulnerable smart camera, thermostat, and baby monitor endpoints to study attacker behaviour and support digital forensics.

data.name: Smart Camera / Baby Monitor
data.description: IoT cameras targeted by criminals to gain audio/video access without the owner's knowledge or permission

threats.title: Brute Force Login (Password Guessing)
threats.description: Attackers using password libraries and common weak/default passwords and credentials to gain access to camera feed.
threats.mitigation: Using stronger passwords and changing the default credentials to a more secure one. Rate limiting and honeypot detection to capture attacker IP and behaviour.

threats.title: Credential Stuffing
threats.description: Reusing breached passwords from other services to hijack the cameras.
threats.mitigation: Enforcing Multi-Factor Authentication and implementing rate limiting (limit login attempts per IP within a timeframe. Using credential stuffing detection tools and a honeypot to capture attempted leaked credentials for further analysis.

threats.title: Real-Time Streaming Protocol (RTSP) Stream Hijacking
threats.description: Hijacking real-time video feed to spy or manipulate video feeds.
threats.mitigation: Enforcing strong authentication and enabling encryption. Using RTSP endpoints to log all unauthorized attempts and restricting network access to segment the network. Implementing secure session management.

data.name: External Probe/ Scanning
data.description: Initial attack vectors like credential stuffing, etc.

data.name: Internal Pivot
data.description: After compromising the router through elevation of privilege, the attacker accesses the IoT cameras

data.name: Direct Camera Access
data.description: External Probes that bypass the router through exposed UPnP ports, etc.

data.name: Home IoT Router / Gateway
data.description: A device that is commonly exploited through weak/default credentials and outdated firmware.

threats.title: Router Exploit with Default Credentials
threats.description: Attackers logging in using the default admin password.
threats.mitigation: Changing factory-set usernames and passwords and diasbling remote management. Using a honeypot to log router login attempts and fingerprinting behaviour.

threats.title: Botnet Infections (e.g. the Mirai Botnet)
threats.description: Malware infecting the router and recruiting it for DDoS attacks.
threats.mitigation: Changing default credentials. Disabling unnecessary services like Telnet, SSH, and UPnP if it's not needed. Firmware updates. Isolating IoT devices on a separate VLAN or subnet to implement network segmentation.

data.name: Internal Threat Actors
data.description: Abusive Partners, Babysitters, Malicious family members

data.name: Video Streaming Service
data.description: Handles live feed delivery and is often vulnerable to session hijacking

data.name: Logging/Evidence Collection
data.description: Crucial for forensics. It is also often vulnerable to log poisoning and deletion

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: Vulnerable to log poisoning and deletion
